{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3498291,"name":"Anderson Hall","username":"Xactlysharp","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/xactlysharp/{size}/186572_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T21:01:26.260Z","cooked":"

Our team has been trying to run two OV9281 cameras off of photonvision running on an RPI 4B, but we had issues with our RPI throttling because of low power, on 5V 2A. This resulted in crashes on our PV server.

How should we power our cameras? how should we get the data to our RPI or other coprocessor?

We are willing to buy a new coprocessor, and are looking into an orange pi 4.

I can provide pictures and such if needed

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-01-31T21:01:40.592Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":62,"readers_count":61,"score":57.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":484506,"topic_slug":"help-with-powering-vision-system","display_username":"Anderson Hall","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07VQWXGSQ?smid=A28OX7WYE3AQZI&psc=1","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Amazon.com: Spinel 720P Global Shutter Monochrome USB Camera Module OV9281 Sensor with 95 Degree Non-Distortion Lens, Support 1280x720@120fps, UVC Compliant, Support Most OS, Focus Adjustable, P/N: UC10MPC_ND : Electronics","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55065,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8088 Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/help-with-powering-vision-system/484506/1","custom_user_title":"8088 Alumni","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3498296,"name":"Sam","username":"Sam948","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sam948/{size}/261363_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T21:05:46.015Z","cooked":"

As per the photonvision docs, the recommended power method is through a buck converter.

PhotonVision Documentation

Common Hardware Setups

PhotonVision requires dedicated hardware, above and beyond a roboRIO. This page lists hardware that is frequently used with PhotonVision. Coprocessors: Orange Pi 5 4GB- Supports up to 2 object dete...

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-01-31T21:05:46.015Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":53,"readers_count":52,"score":30.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":484506,"topic_slug":"help-with-powering-vision-system","display_username":"Sam","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.photonvision.org/en/v2025.1.1/docs/quick-start/common-setups.html#power","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Common Hardware Setups - PhotonVision Docs","clicks":13}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63767,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8847A | PV"},"post_url":"/t/help-with-powering-vision-system/484506/2","custom_user_title":"8847A | PV","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3498297,"name":"Sam","username":"Sam948","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sam948/{size}/261363_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T21:06:27.451Z","cooked":"

The camera power ought to be supplied by the coprocessor, and I’m not quite sure what you mean by getting the data to the coprocessor.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-01-31T21:06:27.451Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":50,"readers_count":49,"score":35.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":484506,"topic_slug":"help-with-powering-vision-system","display_username":"Sam","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63767,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8847A | PV"},"post_url":"/t/help-with-powering-vision-system/484506/3","custom_user_title":"8847A | PV","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3498299,"name":"Anderson Hall","username":"Xactlysharp","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/xactlysharp/{size}/186572_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T21:08:39.735Z","cooked":"

Whenever we power the cameras via the coprocessor, it starts to throttle due to low power.

I was thinking of using a separate power supply for the cameras and getting data from the cameras to the coprocessor

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-01-31T21:08:39.735Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":39,"readers_count":38,"score":12.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":484506,"topic_slug":"help-with-powering-vision-system","display_username":"Anderson Hall","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":63767,"username":"Sam948","name":"Sam","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sam948/{size}/261363_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55065,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8088 Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/help-with-powering-vision-system/484506/4","custom_user_title":"8088 Alumni","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3498303,"name":"Anderson Hall","username":"Xactlysharp","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/xactlysharp/{size}/186572_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T21:10:56.621Z","cooked":"

We powered the coprocessor via a VRM which afaik is just two step-down converters, to 5v and 12v

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-01-31T21:10:56.621Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":37,"readers_count":36,"score":12.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":484506,"topic_slug":"help-with-powering-vision-system","display_username":"Anderson Hall","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":63767,"username":"Sam948","name":"Sam","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sam948/{size}/261363_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55065,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8088 Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/help-with-powering-vision-system/484506/5","custom_user_title":"8088 Alumni","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3498308,"name":"Sam","username":"Sam948","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sam948/{size}/261363_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T21:12:57.211Z","cooked":"

The VRM doesn’t provide enough power, that’s why it’s showing throttling. You need to power it using one of the converters I linked above, or something analogous.

If you do this, you don’t need a separate power supply.
